content:
1. Niagara Falls - formed by the erosion of soft rock layers by the powerful flow of the Niagara River.

2. Victoria Falls - formed by the Zambezi River flowing over a basalt plateau and eroding over time to create a deep gorge.

3. Angel Falls - formed by the erosion of a sandstone and quartzite mountain by the Churun River.

4. Iguazu Falls - formed by the convergence of the Iguazu and Parana rivers.

5. Yosemite Falls - formed by the melting of snow and ice and the flow of the Yosemite Creek over a granite cliff.

6. Kaieteur Falls - formed by the erosion of sandstone and conglomerate rocks by the Potaro River.

7. Gullfoss - formed by the Hvita River flowing over a series of volcanic rocks.

8. Seljalandsfoss - formed by the melting of glaciers and the flow of the Seljalands River over a cliff made of basalt and tuff.
